title: Cardi B appears to confirm Stefon Diggs split at L.A. concert
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Cardi B hinted at a breakup with Patriots receiver Stefon Diggs during her L.A. concert performance.
Cardi B's comments follow breakup rumors fueled by their mutual Instagram unfollowing after the Patriots' Super Bowl loss.
Stefon Diggs is facing legal issues, with an upcoming April 1 pre-trial hearing on battery and strangulation charges.

title: UMass ordered to lift suspension for student who organized pro-Palestinian protest
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: A judge ruled UMass violated a student's First Amendment rights by suspending him for a pro-Palestinian protest.
Junior Kivlighan de Montebello was suspended after leading a protest against RTX at a career fair in September 2025.
The court ordered UMass to allow Montebello to return to classes and barred further sanctions during ongoing litigation.

title: Hanover police officer charged with motor vehicle homicide in fatal Brockton hit-and-run
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Hanover officer Thomas Hayes charged with motor vehicle homicide in Brockton hit-and-run incident involving pedestrian Alfredo Alves.
Hayes hit Alves with an SUV after leaving Brockton strip club, allegedly driving aggressively after drinking with friends.
Hayes was arraigned, pleaded not guilty, and is held on $15,000 bail; placed on administrative leave pending trial.

title: Choosing a product that fixes foggy headlights
author: John Paul
bullets: AAA's Car Doctor suggests Meguiar’s Keep Clear Headlight Coating to prevent re-fogging after cleaning foggy headlights.
Headlight fogging is caused by UV damage and particulate wear, often affecting up to 90% of light transmission.
Routine headlight cleaning is a part of preventive maintenance and may outperform aftermarket replacements in performance.

title: Man arrested in Fenway on child rape, human trafficking charges
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Talik Rashaun Garcia, 36, was arrested in Fenway on charges related to child rape and human trafficking.
Garcia faced multiple charges, including child sexual exploitation and possession of child pornography, in a Boston court.
He was released on $5,000 bail with conditions to avoid contact with alleged victims and minors, except his own children.

title: Man charged with motor vehicle homicide in Pittsfield hit and run that saw victim dragged 4 miles, DA says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: William Gross, 65, charged with motor vehicle homicide in the death of 69-year-old William Colbert in Pittsfield.
Colbert was found dead near Best Western Hotel, dragged nearly four miles from the crash site, prosecutors stated.
Gross arrested after investigation and faces charges; arraignment set for Central Berkshire District Court on Wednesday.

title: Mass. RMV lottery opens for 250th anniversary license plates. Here’s how to apply.
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Massachusetts RMV is holding a lottery for low-number 250th anniversary license plates, marking the state's historical celebration.
Eligible residents can apply for free through the RMV Online Service Center from Feb. 16 to April 17, 2026.
The lottery will randomly assign 1,000 plates, with winners announced by the first week of May, 2026.

title: Massachusetts becomes first state to use ChatGPT in the executive branch, drawing criticism
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Massachusetts is the first state to implement ChatGPT for its nearly 40,000 executive branch employees in phases.
The AI assistant aims to improve government efficiency, with secure measures to protect state data and employee input.
Some state workers and the National Association of Government Employees express concerns about AI reducing job duties.

title: Close to 100 jobs lost as 2 Massachusetts packaging plants shut down
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Garlock Flexibles is closing its Gardner, MA, facilities at 164 Fredette St. and 77 Industrial Rowe, affecting 91 employees.
The closures are expected by the end of September, retaining only a few administrative and leadership roles.
Garlock Flexibles was acquired by Astara Capital Partners in 2021 and rebranded in 2023, focusing on flexible packaging solutions.

title: Assailant in Pawtucket hockey rink shooting killed ex-wife and son, police confirm
author: Abby Patkin and Molly Farrar
bullets: Robert Dorgan killed his ex-wife Rhonda Dorgan and son Aidan Dorgan at a Pawtucket hockey rink.
Three others, including Rhonda Dorgan's parents and a family friend, were critically injured in the shooting.
Robert Dorgan died by suicide after being subdued by bystanders at the scene; police investigate his motives.
